com.camerontec.catalys.core.session.connection

Class SocketConnection

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.camerontec.catalys.util.configuration.AbstractConfigurable
      • com.camerontec.catalys.core.session.connection.ConnectionBase
        • com.camerontec.catalys.core.session.connection.SocketConnection
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Connection, IConfigurable, IRegisterable, Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    SSLSocketConnection

    public class SocketConnection
extends ConnectionBase
    TCP/IP Socket implementation of Connection interface.
    See Also:
    Connection, Serialized Form

      • SocketConnection

        public SocketConnection(String hostName,
                        int port,
                        int timeout)
        When started, this will try to connect to a server socket at the given hostName and port within the specified timeout. The timeout is considered to be in milliseconds and a timeout of zero is interpreted as an infinite timeout.
        Parameters:
        hostName - a host name
        port - a port
        timeout - connection timeout

      • SocketConnection

        public SocketConnection(InetAddress ipAddress,
                        int port,
                        int timeout)
        When started this will try to connect to a server socket at the given Internet address and port within the specified timeout. The timeout is considered to be in milliseconds and a timeout of zero is interpreted as an infinite timeout.
        Parameters:
        ipAddress - an IP address
        port - a port
        timeout - connection timeout

      • createSocket

        protected Socket createSocket(String hostname,
                              int port,
                              String localHost,
                              int localPort,
                              int timeout)
                       throws IOException
        Returns with a connected socket. If a proxy configured the connection will use it. This method must be reimplemented by each subclass to return a Socket of the correct type. It cannot be static, since polymorphic behaviour is required.
        Parameters:
        hostname - Name of host we want a socket to.
        port - Port number to connect to.
        localHost - Our host address - the socket will bind to the local address and port supplied. If the specified host is null it is the equivalent to specifying an address of the loopback interface and localPort is not used by the method.
        localPort - Our local port.
        timeout - Timeout for the connect in milliseconds.
        Returns:
        a connected socket
        Throws:
        IOException - if the attempt to make a connection failed.
        SocketTimeoutException - if timeout expires before connecting.

      • createSocket

        protected Socket createSocket(String hostname,
                              int port,
                              String localHost,
                              int localPort)
                       throws IOException
        Returns with a connected socket. If a proxy configured the connection will use it. This method must be reimplemented by each subclass to return a Socket of the correct type. It cannot be static, since polymorphic behaviour is required.

        Equivalent to createSocket( hostname, port, localHost, localPort, 0 ).

        Parameters:
        hostname - a host name
        port - a port
        localHost - the local binding host
        localPort - the local binding port
        Returns:
        a connected socket
        Throws:
        IOException - if an exception occurs when connecting

      • createSocket

        protected Socket createSocket(String hostname,
                              int port,
                              int timeout)
                       throws IOException
        Returns with a connected socket. If a proxy configured the connection will use it. This method must be reimplemented by each subclass to return a Socket of the correct type. It cannot be static, since polymorphic behaviour is required.

        Equivalent to createSocket( hostname, port, null, 0, timeout ).

        Parameters:
        hostname - a host name
        port - a port
        timeout - connection timeout
        Returns:
        a connected socket
        Throws:
        IOException - if an exception occurs when connecting

      • getServerSocket

        public ServerSocket getServerSocket()
                             throws IOException
        This method returns a ServerSocket suitable for accepting multiple connections. It is to be used for creating a multi-threaded FIX server. Client code that uses this method to obtain the ServerSocket need not (and should not) call the start() method. Instead, a new SocketConnection should be created for each incoming connection.

        Typical usage is: 

                SocketConnection conn = new SocketConnection( 2000 );
        ServerSocket acceptSocket = conn.getServerSocket();
        while ( true ) {
            conn = new SocketConnection( acceptSocket );
            conn.start();
            ... etc ...
        }
        Returns:
        A ServerSocket suitable for accepting incoming connections.
        Throws:
        IOException - TBD

      • start

        public void start()
           throws IOException
        This actually tries to create a TCP/IP socket connection that can be used for communication.

        If this object has been created using a server style constructor (one that listens for connections), this method will actually start listening, only returning once a connection has been received.

        If this object has been created using a client type constructor (one that tries to connect to a listening socket) this method will actually make the connection attempt.

        Specified by:
        start in interface Connection
        Overrides:
        start in class ConnectionBase
        Throws:
        IOException - if the attempt to make a connection failed.
        SocketTimeoutException - if timeout expires before connecting.

      • getListenPort

        public String getListenPort()

      • configure

        public void configure(IConfiguration configuration)
               throws ConfigurationException
        Description copied from interface: IConfigurable
        Apply the IConfiguration to this IConfigurable.

        This method is called by the configuration module in the server:

        • when loading the configuration at server startup (e.g. when reading the XML configuration file) and
        • every time we reload the configuration object corresponding to the configurable run-time object.
        The Catalys Server passes a reference to a configuration clone. The original reference is unavailable to the configurable object. The configurable object may decide to store the reference as the last valid configuration object which can be used to optimize the re-configuration.
        Specified by:
        configure in interface IConfigurable
        Overrides:
        configure in class ConnectionBase
        Parameters:
        configuration - the immutable configuration object
        Throws:
        ConfigurationException - This exception is thrown when the new configuration object cannot be applied to the configurable object.
